questions.question: You want to make a Bitcoin payment that confirms quickly during high network congestion. What should you do?

options.a: Wait for network congestion to decrease
options.c: Split the payment into smaller amounts

questions.explanation: During congestion, miners prioritize transactions with higher fees. Increasing your fee rate improves the chance of quick confirmation.

questions.question: Your Bitcoin wallet shows 'unconfirmed' for a transaction you sent 30 minutes ago. What is most likely happening?

options.b: The transaction is still in the mempool waiting for confirmation

questions.explanation: Unconfirmed transactions are valid but haven't been included in a block yet. This is normal during congestion or with low fees.

questions.question: You're setting up a new Bitcoin wallet. What is the MOST important thing to do first?
questions.explanation: Your seed phrase is the master key to all your bitcoin. Without a secure backup, you risk losing everything if your device fails.

questions.question: Someone asks you to send Bitcoin to their address. What should you verify before sending?

options.a: That you typed the address correctly
options.b: That the address format looks valid

questions.explanation: Always verify the address is typed correctly (copy-paste is safer) and that it's a valid Bitcoin address format to avoid losing funds.

questions.question: You receive an email claiming to be from your wallet provider asking for your seed phrase. What should you do?

options.a: Provide the seed phrase for verification
options.b: Never share your seed phrase with anyone
options.c: Call the support number in the email
options.d: Share only half of the words

questions.explanation: Legitimate services will never ask for your seed phrase. This is always a scam attempt to steal your bitcoin.

questions.question: You want to buy something online with Bitcoin but want to protect your privacy. What technique should you consider?

options.b: Generate a new receiving address for change

questions.explanation: Privacy requires multiple techniques: VPNs hide IP addresses, fresh addresses prevent linking, and mixing breaks transaction history links.

questions.question: Your transaction has been stuck unconfirmed for hours. What are your options?

options.a: Wait it out or use Replace-By-Fee (RBF) if enabled

questions.explanation: You can wait for confirmation or use RBF to replace the transaction with a higher fee. There's no Bitcoin support to contact.

questions.question: You're traveling internationally and want to access your Bitcoin. What's the most important thing to bring?

options.b: Printed copies of your private keys
options.c: Your seed phrase memorized or securely stored

questions.explanation: With your seed phrase, you can restore your wallet on any device anywhere. Physical devices can be lost, stolen, or confiscated.

questions.question: You want to receive regular Bitcoin payments from clients. What's the best practice?

options.b: Generate a unique address for each payment

questions.explanation: Unique addresses for each payment improve privacy and make it easier to track which clients have paid.

questions.question: Your friend sends you a Bitcoin transaction ID and says 'the payment is sent.' How can you verify this?

options.a: Check a blockchain explorer with the transaction ID
options.b: Wait for your wallet to update

questions.explanation: Blockchain explorers let you independently verify any transaction using its ID, confirming the payment exists and its details.

questions.question: You accidentally sent Bitcoin to a wrong address. What can you do?

options.a: Contact Bitcoin support to reverse it
options.b: File a dispute with your bank

questions.explanation: Bitcoin transactions are final and irreversible by design. Always double-check addresses before sending.

questions.question: You run a business and want to accept Bitcoin payments. What should you consider for tax purposes?

options.b: Keep records of Bitcoin received and its USD value at time of receipt
options.d: Wait until you convert to cash to report

questions.explanation: In most jurisdictions, Bitcoin payments are taxable events requiring documentation of the amount and USD value when received.

questions.question: Your phone with your Bitcoin wallet app is stolen. What should you do immediately?

options.a: Report it to the police only
options.b: Transfer your Bitcoin to a new wallet using your seed phrase
options.d: Wait to see if you get the phone back

questions.explanation: Immediately move your Bitcoin to a new wallet using your seed phrase backup before the thief can access your funds.

questions.question: You want to give Bitcoin as a gift to someone new to cryptocurrency. What's the safest approach?

options.a: Send it to an exchange account for them
options.b: Create a paper wallet and help them set up proper storage
options.c: Give them your wallet's private key
options.d: Send it to their email address

questions.explanation: A paper wallet gives them immediate ownership while you help them learn proper security practices for long-term storage.

questions.question: You're buying Bitcoin from someone in person. What safety precautions should you take?

options.a: Meet in a public place and verify the transaction before paying
options.b: Always pay first to show good faith
options.c: Meet at your home for privacy

questions.explanation: Meet in public for safety, and always verify the Bitcoin transaction has been sent and confirmed before handing over payment.
